content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES
────────────────────
No new structures have been successfully placed on the map. The agent made several attempts to establish a Lab at position (0.5, 2.5) for supplying Automation Science Packs to research but was unable to complete the placement or craft the Lab due to resource shortages and missing sub‐ingredients. Although pre‐existing smelting facilities were referenced (an iron furnace at Position(5.0, 5.0) and a copper furnace at Position(–27.0, –60.0)) to process ores, no new multi‐entity production structures have been assembled by the agent.

ERROR TIPS
──────────
• API Argument Handling  
 – When calling get_entities, supply its parameters exactly as defined. Avoid unexpected keyword arguments (such as “radius”) and ensure that positional arguments are in line with the function’s actual signature.

• Inventory and Placement Verification  
 – Before attempting to place a Lab at (0.5, 2.5), confirm that a Lab item exists in the inventory.  
 – Validate that retrieval functions return a proper iterable (using a fallback to an empty list if necessary) to avert errors from iterating over a None value.

• Crafting Prerequisites and Resource Checks  
 – Verify that all necessary sub-ingredients (for example, iron-gear-wheels, electronic-circuits, and copper-cables) are available or can be produced from existing smelting operations before initiating Lab crafting.  
 – Monitor resource counts (such as iron plates and copper plates) to ensure that production chains for composite items are complete and meet recipe requirements.

• Consistent Error Recovery  
 – Incorporate fallback checks and proper error handling when functions return None or unexpected types to prevent propagation of TypeErrors or similar issues during critical operations.
